entries.title: USD/PHP May Test Psychological 59 Level in Near Term, Barclays Says
entries.description: Elevated onshore dollar demand, the Philippine central bank’s communication leaning to the dovish side and only “modest intervention” in the foreign-exchange market should keep the Philippine peso trading on the back foot, Barclays’ FICC research...

entries.title: Hamas Leader Sinwar Holds Firm on Demands for Gaza Cease-Fire With Israel
entries.description: The group’s chief in Gaza issued his first response to a plan promoted by President Biden, as Palestinian officials accused Israel of killing dozens in an airstrike.

entries.title: No One Wants a New Car in 2024. Here's Why.
entries.description: Why are so many Americans forgoing new vehicles? Used cars are not just a better bargain, they retain designs and features more coveted than their high-tech replacements.

entries.title: Against D-Day Backdrop, Biden to Put Democracy at Center of Anti-Trump Pitch
entries.description: The president plans to offer an argument that worked for Democrats in 2022, but polls show voters now worry more about inflation and other issues.

entries.title: Oil Rises as Markets Continue to Weigh OPEC+ Plans
entries.description: Oil futures rose in early Asian trade. Crude has gained after OPEC+ ministers said the group still retains the option to pause or reverse oil production changes if necessary, UOB said.

entries.title: More »
entries.description: The lie that cracked open the hidden life of one of Google's greatest allies

entries.title: Japan Defends Its Turf in the Global Chip Wars
entries.description: With subsidies and a $6 billion acquisition, Tokyo wants to make its companies indispensable in the global supply chain.

entries.title: One Way Not to Get the Job: Interview From Your Bed
entries.description: Job candidates don’t always dress to impress, but most know not to show up for the interview in their pajamas.

entries.title: The Hidden Life of Google's Secret Weapon
entries.description: Joshua Wright cleared a path to domination for the world’s biggest tech companies, keeping regulators at bay while juggling inappropriate relationships and skirting conflict-of-interest standards at every turn.

entries.title: Netflix Sued for Defamation Over 'Baby Reindeer' Character
entries.description: A woman who claims she was falsely depicted as a stalker in Richard Gadd’s Netflix hit “Baby Reindeer” has sued the streaming service for defamation.

entries.title: JGBs Mixed Amid Focus on BOJ's Bond Purchases
entries.description: JGBs were mixed in the morning Tokyo session amid focus on whether the Bank of Japan adjusts the amount of its purchases today at the scheduled buying of 1- to 3-year bonds, 5- to 10-year securities and 10- to 25-year debt.

entries.title: Gold Steady, Supported by Global Rate-Cut Prospects
entries.description: Gold was steady in the early Asian session, supported by global rate-cut prospects driven by the ECB and the Bank of Canada lowering rates this week, which would enhance the appeal of the non-interest-bearing precious metal.

entries.title: Greylock Leads $36 Million Financing for Cybersecurity Startup Seven AI
entries.description: The new company uses artificial intelligence to help enterprises combat cyberattacks.

entries.title: Netflix Shareholders Vote to Recommend Refreshed Executive-Pay Plan
entries.description: Less than 30% of the company’s shareholders voted in favor of last year’s compensation package. Thursday’s vote is nonbinding.

entries.title: A Pretty Pink Cocktail and the Fierce Female Bartending Competition That Produced It
entries.description: It took a little friendly competition and a willingness to play to produce this remarkably refreshing tequila drink. It’s exactly what the Speed Rack community of female bartenders around the world does best.

entries.title: Nikkei Flat, Supported by Shipping, Energy Stocks
entries.description: The Nikkei Stock Average was flat at 38697.16 as gains in shipping and energy shares help offset losses in machinery and pharmaceutical stocks.

entries.title: Bankrupt MMA Law Firm Gets Creditors' Lawyers Disqualified
entries.description: Judge rules that a lawyer’s communications with MMA as a prospective client could be used against the bankrupt insurance-law firm.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia Set to Raise Over $11.2 Billion From Aramco Stock Offering
entries.description: The kingdom is expected to price shares at $7.27 each, toward the lower end of the targeted range.

entries.title: HF Foods Settles Fraud Charges With SEC, to Pay $3.9 Million Fine
entries.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said it had settled fraud charges against food-distributor HF Foods related to a former executive buying luxury cars.

entries.title: How Electric Vehicles Can Make Everyone Happy
entries.description: Ending subsidies, mandates and tariffs would expand use of EVs while letting people continue driving the cars they want.
